sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you give a <radical>machine</radical> a <radical>heart</radical> it will get <kanji>lazy</kanji>. Hearts give us emotions and with emotions we become weak. Why would a machine with a heart want to work anymore? Nah. It's lazy time now.
meaningInfo: Picture a machine with a heart, lying on the couch, eating oil snacks, and snoozing. What a lazy machine!
readingMnemonic: The machine is so <kanji>lazy</kanji> it won't even wear its <reading>tie</reading> (<ja>たい</ja>) anymore. That was the only official thing left about it, but now it's as lazy as a human. Would a lazy human put on a tie? I don't think so.
readingInfo: Picture the lazy machine sitting on the couch again. There are untied ties all over the floor.
